Topic.Title: android op system is dead and based on fraud

Message.Msg: Hardly. Go read NY Times article today on if Apple has right to sue GOOG for the Android System. They don't. Apple and Motorola Mobility are suing each other for patent infringements, but that's different, not based on the Android System. GOOG was sued by ORACLE last year which claimed Android Software violated Oracle's "Java Software". ORCL lost that suit and was ordered to pay money to GOOG, or did you forget?

Topic.Title: Google Releases Statement on Samsung Vs. Apple, Says the Patents Involved Don’t Relate to Core Android

Message.Msg: And Apple's designs violate tons of Motorola's Patent. Motorola has alot more patents on the cell-phone field than does Apple. So worst-case, Apple and Motorola will cross-license each other some patents. Meantime, read a NY Times article today on whether Apple can sue Google on Android. It notes Apple has NOT done such, rather goes after the hardware manufacturers if they copy Apple phones too much. Article notes GOOG doesn't even make money selling Android Op System software, so how can one sue for damages, even if could prove infringement? Samsung got sued because its designs did slavishly copy Apple, yet it refused to pay any licensing fees.

Message.Title: GOOG/Android will beat out AAPL it is inevitable
Message.Msg: Tweaking a few things will not stop Android phones from continuing to outgrow AAPL. Android is growing so much faster and activating phones at a rate that dwarfs them. GOOG is pulling the Amazon model in that they will be offering products that are cheaper and comparable to AAPL that will be demanded by both consumers and spectrum providers. The cellular network owners will not pay AAPL subsidy forever. AAPL must continue to come out with cutting edge fasion phones that people will pay thru the nose for or will have to cut prices.Cutting prices and hurting profits are inevitable to protect the real value of the ecosystem. Eventually when GOOG android controls the world they will monetize it. Just like Amazon will eventually do after they put most retail out of business. In the meantime GOOG is not hardware dependent. They have other real revenue streams.

Message.Title: GOOG should look at VELT:
Message.Msg: Velti report reveals android is gaining mobile ad market share from iOS (VELT) 7.19 : Co releases its July 'State of Mobile Advertising' report, co's monthly insight into industry trends. The data reveals that although the majority of mobile ad impressions are still recorded on Apple's (AAPL) iOS handsets, Android (GOOG) took 4% of market share from Apple. Apple devices now claim 58% of in-app ad impressions; volumes for iPhone models dropped from 31% to 27% in July and also fell from 22% to 19% for the iPod Touch. The report adds, iOS still dominates tablets where mobile in-app advertising impressions rose from nine to 12% for iPads. The rise may be attributed to the new tablet's recent launch in China, where traffic increased by 150% during its first week. Globally, the new iPad is now closing the gap on its predecessor for ad impressions. In the five months post release, the new model has 20% of total impressions, while the iPad 2 had 24% of volumes at the same point in its lifecycle. Co's research highlights the Android tablet market is changing, although Samsung (SSNLF) is still the leading Android tablet manufacturer overall, Amazon's (AMZN) Kindle Fire is the most successful model with 38%.

Topic.Title: anybody think this is a good area to short?

Message.Msg: Overconfidence can be deadly but lack of confidence can sometimes be helpful. If your not confident about whether it's a good time to short, don't. There's plenty of opportunities in this market. Wait for an opportunity you feel good about. Having said that, GOOG is approaching their high of the year, so if GOOG stumbles and trips in their approach to 680, it may be time to short.
